title: Understanding Data Cleaning
text: Data cleaning involves preparing and validating data for analysis. This helps maintain quality, reduce errors, and enhance understanding of the dataset. Think about tasks that improve data consistency and accuracy.

title: Evaluating Data Tasks
text: Evaluate each of the tasks provided closely to see which directly relate to data cleaning. Data connecting or manipulation tasks are typically not considered cleaning activities.

title: Removing Unnecessary Columns
text: Is removing unnecessary columns an act of cleaning or preparing data? Cleaning involves removing or correcting unwanted data.

title: Changing Case of Data
text: Consider whether uniformly changing text case in the data affects its cleanliness. Does it help maintain data consistency?

title: Connecting to the Data
text: Think about whether direct connection to a data source involves data preparation or transformation, or if it's a data cleaning activity.

title: Removing Unnecessary Spaces
text: Reflect on whether removing unnecessary white spaces in data entries results in higher data quality by improving readability and consistency.

title: Making the Right Choice
text: Remember, data cleaning tasks involve enhancing data's usability by eliminating errors and inconsistencies. Review your choices to include only those aligned with this definition.
